 Page |2 JUDGMENT 1.
facts:
In this case accused Jamun Biswakarma, Thakur Prasad Biswakarma and Ganesh Rai are put for trial for the allegation of charge under Section 4 of the POCSO Act.
Hence, this prosecution case.


3. The ejahar was filed by the complainant Sri-Bir;Bahadur BIswakarma before the OC,Missamari Police Station on 28-05-2017.


4, On receipt of the ejahar, O/C, Missamari Police Station registered the case vide Missamari Police Station Case No.61/17 under Section 376(d) of IPC, r/w Section 6 of POCSO Act.
After completion.of investigation, O/C, Missamari Police Station sent up the case against the.accused persons under Section 4 of POCSO Act.


5. On being appeared the accused before this Court, after hearing both the parties, charge framed.under Section 4 of POCSO Act.
Particulars of the charge was read over, explained)to the accused to which he pleaded not guilty and claimed to be tried.
6. To substantiate the case, prosecution examined as many as seven witnesses\which include informant and victim.
After examination of the 7 witness,
learned Counsel for the accused submitted to close the prosecution evidence on the ground that this is a case under Section 4 of POCSO Act, where the victim no way support the prosecution case and it would be futile to examine the other witnesses.
Thereafter, her father along with one Subba filed this case.
After instituting the case, she made statement before the learned Magistrate under Section 164 CrPC.
Therefore, the victim no way reveals any material against any of the accused.
issue:
10. The point for decision in this case is that  (1) Whether on 26-05-2017, at Kalamati,
Rupanjal, under Missamari PS, the accused persons committed penetrative sexual assault on Miss "X and thereby committed an _ offence punishable under Section 4 of POCSO Act?

Reasons, Decisions and reason for decision:

 

11.
ANALYSIS:
The local public caught the aecused persons and handed over to police.
Even they have no-any. objection, if the accused persons are enlarged on acquittal.
During that time, she interpreted the language of the victim into Assamese.
All the accused persons came separately.
Police recorded her statement.
She does not know whether the victim can speak or understand Assamese language.

19.
The accused persons are charged under Section 4 of POCSO Act.
To prove under Section 4 of POCSO Act, prosecution must prove the ingredients as enumerated Section 3 of POCSO Act.


21. Penetrative Sexual assault  

The statement of victim Miss X does not reveal any ingredients of the aforesaid Section.
Therefore, charge under Section 4 of POCSO Act failed.
decision:
Hence, I do not have any hesitation to acquit the accused.
Accordingly, accused persons are acquitted and set them at liberty forthwith.
